alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 3:33PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Rain and snow mix to affect northern Nevada Sunday... Moisture from a series of strong Pacific weather features will move into northwest Nevada late tonight into Sunday bringing higher elevation snow and a rain snow mix to valleys across Humboldt county, moving into northern Elko county later on Sunday. Higher snow amounts will be concentrated in higher elevations above 5000 feet mainly west of US-95 where 3 to 5 inches of snow is possible by Sunday evening. Less than an inch of snow is expected on most valley roadways with up to 2 inches along mountain passes. Valleys including higher population centers including Winnemucca will likely see a rain snow mix during the day Sunday. Motorists should remain alert to changing weather and road conditions, and reduce speeds over snow covered roadways. More rain and snow is expected Monday and Tuesday across northern Nevada as a strong atmospheric river impacts the region. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
